864943592:
[

Head Of Strategy

Company Name Canva Company Location 2 Lacey Street , Surry Hills, NSW 2010, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 665 views

Job description

At Canva, we build tools that empower the world to design. Since launch in April 2013, our user base has grown exponentially, amassing over 10 million users in over 100 languages, making us one of the world's fastest-growing technology companies. \xa0As of today, we've achieved profitability, and the company is valued over $1-billion, which comfortably prepares us for the next phase of growth and development.


We are now looking for a Head of Strategy to help drive our mission - for everyone to design anything and publish anywhere – and underpin the incredible growth we’re expecting to see just around the corner.


WHAT YOU'LL DO:


As Head of Strategy, you will play a critical leadership role, identifying and acting on our most strategic opportunities. As the head of the strategy team, you will be a trusted thought leader and igniter who works closely with the entire team to drive results across three key dimensions:

    • Business-level strategy:\xa0Work closely with leaders across functions - such as customer happiness, product, marketing, growth, and finance teams - to set our strategy and drive key business initiatives
    • Strategic knowledge & insights:\xa0Develop unique insights on our markets, competitors, and business trends, and disseminate this knowledge and data across Canva to inform key decisions
    • Operational excellence: Help our leaders run Canva efficiently, which includes clarifying accountability, as well as identifying and monitoring critical success metrics. \xa0This will include helping us find and adopt the best tools and systems to enable us to be better and faster.

      • Examples of breadth and importance of the things you might be working on include optimising customer operations, experiment with using tools like chatbots to make our customers more successful, building out an enterprise offering, and identifying organic and inorganic growth pathways. \xa0 In doing this, we’re looking to you to:

    • Drive project execution- structure complex problems, develop hypotheses, conduct analyses, synthesize insights and recommendations, and align cross-functional stakeholders
    • Influence decision making within Canva’s leadership through strong working relationships, effective communication, and compelling output
    • Mentor and cultivate other team members as needed


      • We are a fast growing company, and you will have the opportunity to roll up your sleeves - moving from strategy to execution. \xa0Be excited to get down into the weeds to build out the future Canva that our customers truly need.


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR

    • A self-starter that thrives in ambiguity and a rapidly evolving business landscape.
    • Strong quantitative reasoning and analytical skills, with an ability to see the big picture.
    • A demonstrated ability to translate analytical findings into actionable recommendations.
    • Directly driven complex strategic initiatives with meaningful business impact.
    • Creative but structured thinker with a bias for actionAn ability to balance customer experience and commercial trade-offs.
    • Exceptional interpersonal skills & executive presence – ability to synthesize complex issues and communicate into simple messages for customers, peers, and the rest of the business. \xa0
    • Proven ability to influence, energise, develop and drive change.
    • An enviable ability to understand and quickly learn technical concepts.
    • Grace under fire: ability to present to a range of audiences, deal with ambiguity, and demonstrate composure in stressful situations.
    • Collaborative team player that can drive complex cross-functional projects with multiple stakeholders - bonus points for extensive experience working with Product and Engineering teams.

      • While we’re not prescription on where and how these skills were developed and honed, there’s a good chance you have:

    • 3+ years of experience at a top-tier management consulting firm or within an equivalent corporate strategy group, with experience including overseeing complex strategy projects.
    • 10+ years of total professional experience with increasing levels of responsibility, resulting in a proven track record of leading transformational change.
    • Experience operating in a digital/consumer internet or SaaS environment during a high growth phase.


Benefits

    • Competitive salary, plus equity options
    • Flexible working hours, we value work-life balance
    • In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day
    • Fitness membership allowance, plus free Yoga and Boxing Gym membership
    • Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy
    • Pet-friendly offices
    • Sponsored social clubs and team events
    • Fun and quirky celebrations
    • Relocation budget for interstate or overseas individuals


The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so, with breakout areas, little nooks, and quiet places to retreat.


Want to experience Canva for yourself?

Check out what life is like at Canva on Instagram.

Check out what our users are saying about us on Twitter.

Learn how we work from Dave, our CTO

Check out our Company Reviews on Glassdoor

Meet our CEO, Melanie

Finally, give Canva a go!


We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

APPLY FOR THIS JOB

Job description



Our client is one of Australia's longest established and reputable manufacturing & building Installation Company. This national company is ever growing partnering with top building contractors, private builders and engineers installing roofing & building systems on key commercial & residential projects across the eastern seaboard.

Due to growth, they are now in the market for experienced Roof Plumbers to join their business. This role will include but not limited to the site installation of metal roofing systems such as Colorbond & Standing Seam Panels with products ranging from Aluminium, Brass, and Copper & Zinc on projects across the Sydney Metro.

To be suitable for this role you will need the following;

  • 5 years' + experience in metal roofing / plumbing (commercial or residential)
  • Trade qualified roof plumber desired or European Roofing Trained
  • Construction white card & working at heights qualifications
  • Full PPE Gear & own tools
  • Drivers licence with the ability to travel to and from workshop and site
  • Experience on specialised roofing products like the above mentioned


What's in it for you?
You will have the support of an experienced site team and labourers working on exciting architectural design homes and commercial buildings around Sydney. In return you will be rewarded with a generous salary package inclusive of a base salary, super and car allowance / fully maintained company car. Workshop and office based in the Lower North Shore. Join a reputable and busy company now.

For further information regarding this position or any other opportunities, please contact Patrick Velasco in confidence on 02 9955 2299 / patrick@designandconstruct.com.au or click apply.

866921406:
[

Demand Side Innovation Engineer

Company Name Evoenergy ACT Company Location Canberra, Australian Capital Territory, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity


  • $141, 860 + 15% Superannuation
  • Ongoing, Full Time
  • Canberra Location


Join our Customer Connections branch as the Demand Side Innovation Engineer.


Using your business insight, technical skills and creativity, you will drive key strategic initiatives to lead positive change in line with emerging industry trends. You will shape our distribution network for the future in the long-term interests of energy consumers.


We are looking for someone who knows we can never accept that where we are is where we need to be.


Do you have a passion for change, challenge and triumph?


Then we would love to hear from you.


In this role:
  • You will contribute to the development of our demand management strategy
  • You will promote and embed demand management practices into the planning, delivery and operations of our ‘business as usual’ end-to-end workflows
  • You will contribute to network planning recognising the complex interaction between network technical performance and electrical market arrangements
  • You will collaborate to generate detailed system modelling and associated integral technical work to business case dynamic demand side management options
  • You will build and nurture strong partnerships internally and externally to inspire innovative demand management strategies


More about you:
  • You hold an engineering qualification supported by equivalent work experience
  • You have a deep understanding of operational and planning functions within an electricity and gas distribution network
  • You can demonstrate experience defining and delivering success in demand management and / or innovation programs


We'd love if you had:
  • Further studies in the areas of Energy Management, Demand Management, Renewable Energy or equivalent work experience


About Us

Evoenergy is an electricity and gas distribution business that is committed to providing safe and reliable services to the Australian Capital Territory (ACT). We believe in safety for consumers and employees and by investing in our people, technology and other innovations we strive to exceed our consumers’ needs now and into the future.


We boast a positive safety culture that encourages and inspires because the work we do matters to thousands of Canberrans. We have skilled teams of qualified tradespeople who are passionate about powering our community.


We need our workforce to be as diverse and engaged as the communities we serve, so Evoenergy is an Equal Opportunity Employer who values diversity and inclusion. We encourage applicants from diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, people with disabilities, people from culturally diverse backgrounds and all ages.


We are open to working flexibly with you, so talk to us and ask how this role can be made flexible for you.


We also have a strong focus on gender balance within the organisation and encourage women to apply.


About Canberra

Canberra is the capital of the ACT. It has a population of 400,000 and is a modern city with a cosmopolitan feel. It offers all the city services and lifestyle amenities of a world-class capital, as well as being settled beside the alpine mountains and southeast coast which makes it an extraordinary location for adventure.


Canberra boasts a great food and wine culture and is very family-friendly with progressive education, health care, clean environment, and is home to some of Australia’s best roads and bike paths. It’s a safe, relaxed place to live.


How can I apply?

You should apply through our e-Recruitment portal outlining the key skills and experiences that you can bring to this role.\xa0


We encourage you to address in your cover letter how you will contribute to our progressive demand management transformation.


If you have questions about the role, we encourage you to contact Giuliana Baggoley on (02) 6293 5775.


Or, if you need guidance with the application process, you can contract Talitha Vinall, Evoenergy Talent Partner on (02) 6248 3017.


Applications will close on Sunday 30 September 2018.

\xa0

867027579:
[

Senior Scientist

Company Name Office of Environment and Heritage (NSW) Company Location Lidcombe, AU

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

Job Title: Senior Scientist
Job Grade / Classification: Environment Officer Class 9
Employment Type: Temporary, Full-time
Duration: Up to 30 June 2020
Location: Lidcombe
  • Do you have expertise in leading scientific programs and research for water, wetlands and coastal science?
  • Are you experienced in storing, curating and conducting statistically rigorous assessments of large sets of data?
  • Do you want to play a critical role in the implementation of NSW Government’s Marine Estate Management Authority (MEMA) Strategy?
Agency Overview

The Department of Planning & Environment is the lead NSW Government agency in planning for a growing NSW. The Department is going through an exciting period of organisational and operational change.

The Department’s vision – “Planning for growing NSW: inspiring strong communities, protecting our environment” – provides the benchmark for our partnership and leadership approach to engaging and working collaboratively with key State and Local Government, community and industry stakeholders to deliver better outcomes in the areas of planning, local government and the environment.

The NSW Office of Environment and Heritage is a part of the Planning and Environment Cluster. It aims to enrich life in NSW by helping the community to conserve and enjoy our environment and heritage. For more information go to www.environment.nsw.gov.au .

The role will work for Science Division, which sits within the Office of Environment and Heritage. Science Division provides scientific evidence and knowledge to underpin environmental decision making, regulation and service delivery.

About The Role

Responsible for implementation of OEH components of the Marine Estate Management Authority’s Strategy by providing scientific and team leadership, advanced data management and scientific and analytical input for Water, Wetlands or Coastal science monitoring programs and projects. The role will also contribute to effective project management ensuring that the planning, coordination, execution and reporting of projects is completed efficiently and effectively in the context of organisational project management guidelines.
  • Provide leadership for, and participate in, planning and implementation of monitoring programs and projects associated with the Marine Estate Management Authority’s Strategy
  • Develop high-level data management and storage systems
  • Provide expert advice and communication to relevant internal and external stakeholders
  • Prepare high quality written documentation such as research papers, reports and briefing papers
  • Influence the strategic direction of water, wetlands and coastal science projects
  • Develop and present scientific and technical presentations for non-technical audiences
The successful candidate will need to have availability to travel regularly as this role will involve a lot of time spent working in the field across NSW.

Essential Requirements
  • Scientific qualifications, well-developed knowledge and demonstrated experience in data storage and management.
  • Experience in developing and delivering rigorous monitoring and data management projects in the water, wetlands and/or coastal sciences.
  • Experience in developing, planning and implementing monitoring projects, including accountability for the planning and management of finances and deliverables.
To be successful in the role, ideally you will have:
  • Current NSW boat and car drivers’ licences
Please read the following documents prior to preparing your application:
  • Role description
  • Application Guide
  • Applying for a role in the NSW public Sector
Our Commitment To Diversity And Flexibility

At the Planning and Environment Cluster, we believe a diverse and inclusive workforce contributes to the success of our business and are committed to ensuring that our workforce reflects the communities of NSW.

We understand that flexibility means different things to different people and are committed to offering flexible work arrangements where and when possible.

Good To Know

A Recruitment Pool may be established for future temporary and ongoing roles with similar focus capabilities. The Recruitment Pool may be available to hiring managers from DPE and other NSW Public Sector agencies over a 12-month period.

To Apply

Complete all the questions in the online application. Two of the questions will require you to provide specific examples from your experience (4000-character limit per question). These questions are shown below. Do not address these in your cover letter.

Q1. Please provide an example of a time when you led a team to support a large scientific program/project in water, wetland and coastal science. What was the program/project and how did you contribute to making it a success? What obstacles needed to be overcome to ensure the program/project was delivered on time and to a high standard?

Q2. Please provide an example of a time when you were responsible for reaching a conclusion in order to provide expert advice based on scientific data? What advice did you provide and how did you reach that advice or conclusion?

The information provided in your application needs to show how you meet the focus capabilities and other essential requirements of the role. (Refer to the role description for details about the capabilities and the associated behavioural indicators. The role description also lists the essential role requirements.)

Applications Close: Monday 24 September 2018 at 11:59 pm

Should you require further information about the role please contact; Jaimie Potts 0434 350 234 ( jaimie.potts@environment.nsw.gov.au ). If you have any enquiries regarding the recruitment process please contact Ashlee Chuter (02) 9585 6105.

Job description

  • Do you have a passion to lead change through social media?
    • Showcase your exceptional social media skills by developing and implementing strategies and initiatives to support AIA campaigns
    • Immediate start available, 12 month maternity contract opportunity based in Sydney

    Amnesty International Australia (AIA) currently has an exciting 12 month maternity leave contract available for an experienced Social Media Specialist. This full-time contract position is immediately available and will be based in our Sydney Action Centre. \xa0

    About the Role

    Reporting to the Digital Communications Program Manager, the Social Media Specialist is responsible for growing AIA’s social media footprint by developing and implementing social media strategies and plans. The position utilises analysis and metrics to develop effective strategies that will build and engage our communities through powerful storytelling. You will provide rich content aligned to our priority campaigns, delivered via effective means to mobilise supporters and maximise campaign engagement. You will also train staff and key activists in social media to ensure it is effectively utilised and to help empower activists and other stakeholders in the online environment.

    To be successful in this role, you will have:

    • Proven experience in developing and implementing social media growth strategies
    • Excellent understanding of the social media landscape, best practice principles and current platform trends;
    • Ability to interpret and analyse online metrics through tools such as Google Analytics and Facebook Power Editor to improve project and organisational outcomes;
    • Ability to manage multiple projects and budgets for paid and unpaid social media campaigns; and
    • Professional experience in planning, producing, developing and targeting social media communications, preferably in an advocacy-style organisation;
    • Experience in developing and producing clear and compelling social media content to mobilise and engage target audiences;
    • Excellent communication and negotiation skills, both verbal and written. Advanced social media writing skills;
    • Ability to develop and deliver organisational training in online tools to a diverse stakeholder group, including producing support materials;
    • Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team, under pressure with competing priorities and deadlines.

    In return, you will be rewarded with a flexible, caring, family friendly working environment with the opportunity to work alongside committed and enthusiastic individuals dedicated to achieving change in the world.

    Amnesty International Australia welcomes applications from people with diverse experience including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, and people from different cultural backgrounds.

    If this role sounds like you please apply below by answering a few short questions relating to the selection criteria, and attach your cover letter and CV. Applications close 9am Monday, 20 August 2018. \xa0

Lecturer or Senior Lecturer in Accounting

Company Name University of Newcastle Company Location Sydney CBD, New South Wales, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 18 hours ago Number of views 9 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Newcastle Business School is the larger of 2 schools within the Faculty of Business and Law. The School teaches offshore and in Sydney, Newcastle City, Online and Ourimbah.


About the role

The Newcastle Business School is currently seeking to appoint a suitably qualified academic to a Level B or Level C, on a full-time continuing basis based at either our Central Coast, Newcastle or Sydney locations.


The Lecturer (level B) contributes to the delivery of the University's Strategic Plan in the field of Business as a key member of the School providing excellence in Research and Innovation, Teaching and Learning, and Service and Engagement. The Lecturer combines sound academic research expertise with teaching experience, is expected to be a course coordinator, and is gaining recognition for their contribution to research, teaching, and postgraduate supervision, and is contributing to community engagement.


To succeed in this position you will have:

  • A PhD in accounting (applicants nearing completion in accounting will also be considered).
  • Demonstrated experience obtaining research funding and delivering quality research outputs at a national level.
  • Demonstrated experience in the development, delivery and review of courses and degree programs including the incorporation of contemporary research methods, digital learning platforms, and interdisciplinary approaches.
  • Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills including the ability to participate in a team environment.
  • Willingness and ability to contribute to governance, organisational administration (including course coordination) and initiatives/activities within the University.
  • Knowledge of, and experience in adhering to workplace policies and procedures in the areas of work health safety, equity, diversity and promoting a respectful workplace culture.
  • Ability to mentor and supervise undergraduate, honours and postgraduate students.


The Senior Lecturer (level C) contributes to the delivery of the University's Strategic Plan in the field of Business as a key member of the School providing excellence in Research and Innovation, Teaching and Learning, and Service and Engagement. The Senior Lecturer combines substantial academic expertise and some applied experience and is recognised for their research contribution and for applying their expertise in a range of business contexts.\xa0


The Senior Lecturer is expected to be a course coordinator/ program convener, to undertake postgraduate supervision, demonstrate leadership at disciplinary, cluster and faculty level, and is actively contributing to community engagement. The Senior Lecturer makes a key contribution to the Newcastle Business School, its programs and courses, and plays an important part in ensuring the success of the School and its alignment to the vision of the University.


To succeed in this role you will have:


  • A PhD in accounting.
  • Demonstrated record of high level performance in scholarly activities and outputs, research and research funding.
  • Substantial experience in teaching innovation including incorporating contemporary digital platforms and mediums and collaborative/interdisciplinary approaches to teaching and curriculum development.
  • Proven ability to mentor and supervise undergraduate, honours and postgraduate students.
  • Demonstrated leadership capability including the ability to lead/inspire a team to deliver exceptional performance/outcomes.
  • Demonstrated ability to build external research partnerships and strategic linkages to achieve common goals and positive outcomes for the university.
  • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills including the capacity to build relationships and an inter-disciplinary way of working.
  • Demonstrated experience in contributing to leadership, mentoring, governance and organisational administration within an academic or similar large organisational environment.
  • Knowledge of, and experience in adhering to workplace policies and procedures in the areas of work health safety, equity, diversity and promoting a respectful workplace culture.

Please note: In accordance with the University's Staff Selection Guidelines, your application will be assessed on the selection criteria found at the link below. It is essential that you address each of the criteria to enable the selection committee to properly assess your application and suitability for interview.


Please clearly indicate in your covering letter, which Academic Level you are applying for.


Salary Package: \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

Academic Level B from $95,351 per annum plus 17% super with Unisuper.

Academic Level C from $116,805 per annum plus 17% super with Unisuper.
